DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Identifier ISO21090.II.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that identifies one of a set of conditions that a subject must meet in order to participate in a study, or that a study subject must meet into order to participate in a certain part of the study. A unique symbol that establishes identity of an activity. EXAMPLE(S): 12345 is the identifier for a substance administration

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
